page.title: 04TRANSPORT, KING'S NYMPTON
page.content: The most common form of transport is by private car. Motor bikes are popular with young people and allow them cheap travel to work and entertainment. Bicycles are used by children and school leavers who work locally. Steep hills leading to the village discourage their use. No form of nationalised transport exists and the few bus services are run by private contractors.There is a weekly bus to South Molton on Thursdays,which is Market Day.On Fridays there are services to Barnstaple and Exeter. Children coming to the local school from outlying farms may travel on school buses and the public may also use these buses.In June 1985 a local group set up a minibus service to South Molton twice daily.On Sundays this bus makes a hospital visiting run to The North Devon District Hospital.
